Key Arguments: Government departments and politicians have failed to properly investigate matters they regard as misinformation and disinformation.
There is a lack of thorough examination and public dissemination of facts on issues like climate change and COVID vaccines.
Political agendas are prioritized over transparency and proper scrutiny.
The government is perceived to be restricting freedom of speech and open debate.
Decisions are made arbitrarily to benefit political parties rather than the public.
Main Themes: Distrust in government handling of misinformation and disinformation.
Concerns about lack of transparency and public debate.
Criticism of political agendas influencing information dissemination.
Freedom of speech and open debate.
Notable Quotes: There is too much going off half cocked to avoid proper scrutiny of political agendas and people control.
There need to be properly organised and informed open and public debates on the many issues relating to things like, climate change, Covid vaccines etc.
As things stand there is too much likelihood of governments and government agencies making arbitrary decisions for the benefit of party agendas, to the harm of the Australian people.
